Metadata: Marine and aquatic nonindigenous species in California: an assessment of current status and research needs
Summary of a Program Workshop, San Francisco, California, October 18-19, 1996.

International marine commerce has rapidly accelerated the rate at which nonindigenous species are being introduced in California coastal regions. A workshop on this subject strove: to identify marine, estuarine, and aquatic nonindigenous species and their impacts; and to list research, management, and public outreach needs for dealing with associated problems. These conference proceedings document the current status of and research needs to deal with the problem.
